website_summaries.verdict: Disappointingly harsh pots of coffee make the Bonavita BV1500TS hard to recommend over the Bunn Velocity Brew BT or Bonavita's flagship BV1900TS brewer.
pros: The Bonavita BV1500TS brews a maximum of five cups of coffee so you drink more and waste less
The machine takes up a minimum of kitchen counter space and is easy to use and clean
cons: The BV1500TS doesn't brew coffee as well as Bonavita claims, often resulting in pots of joe that are much too bitter

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Coffee maker worked great for a little over a year then it just stopped, I always use filtered water, descale and thoroughly clean the tank monthly. Recently it would only use half the tank of water then stop, the water is not as hot like it was when new. I also always make a full pot (5 cups) as this is what the instructions state, in the past the water was plenty hot. For the price of this coffee maker it should have worked longer than just one year, I am not a happy customer at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Poor carafe design, early failure of unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee maker based on a Cook’s Illustrated review, but it has never lived up to expectations. The thermal carafe is not only awkward to use, its design prevents easy dispensing of all of the coffee in the pot - you literally have to remove the lid and turn it completely upside down to have a chance of getting that last half cup. And as for the claim that it will keep your coffee piping hot for several hours.....nope. Maybe 1/2 hour, tops. The final straw was when the unit completely failed less than 4 months after purchase - the “on” button no longer does anything. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskan Steve

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy one.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I like with this coffee maker. Lid is a trap for bacteria. It is two parts hinged with a spring and coffee can will stay in between parts until you take it apart and that is not an easy job. The pot will not drain all the way even when it is upside down. You have to get a towel inside the pot in order to dry it. I think the pot is made from Aluminum. When the coffee stays in the pot for I'm guessing more than 4 hours the coffee turns a nasty milky mud brown and the taste reflects the color. Keep your cheap Mr. Coffee maker. .
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good with 2 flaws
customer_reviews.text: Based on a review from Americas Test Kitchen I decided to give this pot a try. I have been trying to reduce the quantity of coffee I drink while increasing the quality. This pot does make very good coffee. 2 cons: 1. There is a lip on the carafe which mean a splash of coffee will always be left and it is annoying to because you can't put out all the water when you clean it. 2. The carafe is not very thermal. It will keep the coffee at a decent temperature for an hour or so which is usually good enough for the 2.5 mugs I get out to it.
customer_reviews.author: Curious George

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed carafe
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry I purchased this coffee maker. I gave it one star because it does make coffee. But the carafe is terrible: (1) It doesn't keep the coffee hot for even one hour; (2) it leaks when you pour; (3) when rinsing, the liquid doesn't come out, it stays in the carafe. You literally have to use a towel to get the liquid out.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bisson

customer_reviews.title: Leaky caraffe since day 1. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a run of the mill coffee maker that comes with a cool looking caraffe that has leaked profusely for my wife and I since the first day we had it. Many reviews talk about the leaking caraffe. When I emailed the Company I got sent to an incredibly annoying product defect process and gave up. We will just be buying another coffee maker from a different brand and never buying from this brand again. Fix your product or make it easy for people to get replacements. It's 2018 no one tolerates this crap anymore. Especially for an 8 cup coffee make that is this expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gandolfo

customer_reviews.title: Not anymore what it use to be
customer_reviews.text: I had a Bonivita coffee maker for years, till the filter basket broke into pieces, Not the machine fault my fault. Because of daily cleaning in the dishwasher. Could not find a filter basket for that machine. Purchased this one. The smell from the thermal carafe was pretty much impossible to get rid off. Coffee didn't taste as good because of that I think. The one I had was really one of the better machine and great tasting coffee. Sometimes it's better for a company to stick to a good product and leave it as is, Trying to invent the wheel again is not always a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Bart S.

customer_reviews.title: Overrated and overpriced, but pretty
customer_reviews.text: I live in Los Angeles, so overrated and overpriced but pretty is common here. While it looks pretty, there is a huge flaw. This picture doesn't show you where the actual lid to the thermal pot is... because you have to leave it on a counter or in a drawer, guaranteeing that you cannot find it when you do actually use this pot. For something that costs as much as this does, it seems that the whole unit and parts could have been kept together. I needed a thermal carafe and this was my choice. I could have made a better choice. I'm not unhappy with this, but not happy. It's just a meh.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: I have the larger of these machines that I love and have no trouble with at all - so ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the larger of these machines that I love and have no trouble with at all - so when we needed a smaller coffee maker - I chose this one. The coffee itself is fine -but the carafe leaks and I can't figure out exactly where it is leaking from but it seems to be from the handle area or around the black rim connected to the stainless steel - and it is a massive leak - not just a little trickle. I will probably return this. Update-I decided not to return it but instead I threw out the carafe it came with and bought the glass carafe. No more leaks and the coffee is great.
customer_reviews.author: pcs

customer_reviews.title: Love the Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on Oct. 30 and started using on 31st. Have used sufficient time to offer a review. SCAA reviewed this maker after I got it and I already liked it. It blooms the coffee. Rated #1 by SCAA...and me. Way better than the old Mr. Junks I had as a starting coffee experience. Getting on 70 and had never used coffee before. I never had good...great coffee until I got this unit. I am really enjoying this experience for the first time. THANKS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Radar999

customer_reviews.title: My only problem with it is the filter basket empties ...
customer_reviews.text: My only problem with it is the filter basket empties directly into the pitcher so you have to put the lid on when it's done brewing. But other than that, it brews quick, keeps the coffee hot, and makes for a more even taste/flavor of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: D. Devine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great flavor
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied. Upgraded from a Mr. Coffee, which I have always liked, but must admit that the Bonavita gives better flavor. I like the auto turnoff when brewing is done, but you must remember to always put the top on the thermos after brewing to keep your coffee hot. Also, I strongly recommend that you fill the pot with hot water and then emptying before brewing. Since it does not have a "hot" plate you must pre-warm the thermos to guarantee you get hot coffee. But these extra steps are worth it because of the great flavor you get from this brewer. Recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Complete mess
customer_reviews.text: The lid leaks, I tried to reach out to bonavita directly and they didn’t respond. And the way it’s designed doesn’t allow for all the liquid to pour out so there’s liquid left and it makes it not great to air dry then. On top of that there is nowhere to set the filter section. Quite honestly it’s a mess every time I use it. I wish I would have tried it when I could still return it but I was trying to use up my pods first and now I regret that because I would have returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!  Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the Bonavita that we loved with a new one because the carafe broke and it was cheaper to buy a new one. I can see why the replacement was cheaper. The new carafe doesn't close well and leaks. We hoped it would get better as we used it, but it's gotten worse. I've touted our old coffee maker, but either we were lucky or Bonavita has gone downhill. Don't buy! If you do, and the carafe leaks, send it back pronto.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I had a Mr Coffee 4 cup coffee maker and honestly I was noticing my coffee was really not good. I was buying great coffee and it was being wasted. I have used this machine for a few weeks and it's way better. Highly recommend. Only thing to keep in mind is it does not stay hot because it does not sit on a heated plate but in the carafe stays hot about an hour OR you can put boiling hot water in it before you make the coffee to heat it up then dump the water out before you brew and that is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding coffeemaker...two mugs perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I have to give this coffee pot five stars. I have a 10 cup Technivorum and needed a smaller pot for just two of us. So, I got the recommendation from the Wirecutter.com and I am very glad I did. This Bonavita makes better coffee than the Technivorum, better than my old Krups, better than the Clever Coffee Maker and better than pour over Melitta. Buy it. It has a couple of flaws (like an awkward pot) but that isn’t really important. What is important is the quality of the coffee it produces. Be sure to use the special intermittent drip function. I think that it is key to getting great coffee. And of course, use specialty coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Rose

customer_reviews.title: Huge Hassle and not durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because Consumer Reports recommended it and they are usually very accurate. Not a fan of this coffee pot at all. Only thing it does well is brew fast and keeps coffee hot. It is such a process to go from beginning to end. You cannot pull the pot early, you have to switch tops to pour water and pour coffee. The lid on the coffee pot is semi stripped after 3 months of use. It is just not built efficiently and I am beyond disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Yes ! It does have a leaky carafe and exactly how is this unit??
customer_reviews.text: I just received this coffee maker yesterday.... I did read the reviews and did see a couple people stating that the carafe leaks.....and IT DOES ! Im not sure the leaking carafe OR the fact that this unit appears to be a 2017😳.... So...it came with a few #4 cone filters to start you and with a coupon for .50 off Melitta filters. Well as I checked out the cashier informed me that the coupon was expired....lol... expired in 2017 ! So.......does that mean this unit has been in this box since 2017? Not sure what to think....debating returning...leakage from the carafe is a real problem!
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: water temperture can only reach 175 F
customer_reviews.text: This coffee machine does not produce the hot water tempertured around 195-205 F as they promised in description. It only produces hot water tempertured from 150-175 F. I emailed the manufacture with a viedo to prove, however they said water temperture 175 F is normal for this machine. So it makes no sense to purchse this machine which I thought will make a perfect cup of coffee with right water temperture. My old coffee machine can reach 175 F too. I am returning this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Qian

customer_reviews.title: Tried twice, going with another brand...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this model to replace another BonaVita that lasted a few years and was great while it lasted. We received this one and noticed the gasket out of place immediately and exchanged for another one. After using it a few times, it started leaking from the same area on the replacement. We're returning and going with a different brand. (Photos show the first item that was defective and returned immediately, and then the leaking from the same area on the replacement.) Other negatives: - You have to use the carafe lid to pour. (Always couple ounces left behind.) - Slow brew time - takes about 10 minutes for 15 ounces.
customer_reviews.author: Joeyoncé

customer_reviews.title: BE CAREFUL of potential HEALTH HAZARD!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this for a while and put it at office for occasional use. The brewed coffee does taste good. Almost want to give 5 star till one day I tried to get some hot water. Humongous scales on the carafe bottom. I first thought it is water scale deposition but after couple Urnex descaler run still same. Then decided to open it up to figure out what is going on. As photos shown here, it is rusty everywhere inside it should not be. It tells me the boiler system has been rusty and leaky, the scaler are rusty metal not water scaler and I probably drink a lot of metal already. BE CAREFUL of HEALTH HAZARD of this product!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: xu zhu

customer_reviews.title: Not just another drip coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is definitely my favorite. Consistent, and flavorful every time. That’s my top priority for a coffee maker. Every other drip brewer I’ve had doesn’t compare. That said, I have a couple small gripes. The carafe isn’t great. It doesn’t seem to insulate as good as it should. Luckily, we’ll finish the pot before it’s an issue. It’s also not the best to clean and water gets “stuck” inside when put through the wash. I also wish it had a brew timer. But, despite those gripes, I’ll suck it up. Great coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Shon

customer_reviews.title: No timer/clock
customer_reviews.text: Cons: After a video w/3 different Bonavita makers and how to set clock/timer, this one has no timer, not sure how I got the wrong model, but no biggie don't always want at a certain time. But because you need to use cool filtered water (which I get from fridge, so not left in container all night, could not use this feature anyway. There is no pause feature, so have to wait until completely brewed to sneak a cup. Also, requires filtered water and requests unplug after each use. (something to remember) Pros: Well made, compact, carafe keeps coffee hot at least 5 hours, nice stainless design.
customer_reviews.author: Delight Kilyan

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect with a few minor annoyances
customer_reviews.text: Great simple coffee maker with a few flaws. There is a ton of steam that escapes the top. The basket does not have like in the newer 8 cup version. It series on top of the carafe. The lid system is effective, but not the easiest to use. If this coffee maker was a bit more user friendly, it would be a home run for everyone. Right now it's a bit niche. People pay for and appreciate convenience. They're was only thought out into the specifications of making a good pot of coffee. Unfortunately, there was no designing simplicity or ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: TerryTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the bad reviews stop you from buying this!
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy this because of the bad reviews, but their were also many great reviews that made me give it a try. If you are looking for the best cup of coffee you've ever made then look no further. It brews hot, not overly hot but the perfect temperature. It brews a tasty cup of coffee and it's fast. Put the cover on before you pour it into your cup so it will pour without dripping. Follow the instructions, run it three times with water before first use. Follow the instructions in the book as to how many scoops and you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker, terrible carafe.
customer_reviews.text: This makes really good coffee, but the carafe is rubbish. You can't pour from it without putting the lid on, else you spill coffee everywhere. With the lid on, though, you can't get all the coffee out. Always a tablespoon or more left in the pot, no matter what you do. Finally, the insulated pot doesn't keep the coffee hot for any length of time. If you don't care about those things then this is the best coffee maker you can get for the money, in my opinion. Even with those (basic) faults,I still love it.
customer_reviews.author: CyberPotato

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good price
customer_reviews.text: It makes better tasting coffee than any other device I've tried, and I've tried many types. Caution, read the instructions carefully. I learned the hard way that you can't take shortcuts in the process. Like when I tried to pour coffee from the carafe before putting on the pour top. Just doesn't work and you end up cleaning coffee from all over the countertop! Screw that top on tight and the coffee pours out well! This is a good small coffee maker and is great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: L2Sides

customer_reviews.title: Okay but not great
customer_reviews.text: First the good. Nicely built and super simple. The single touch operation is nice. Brews quickly and the SS Carafe keeps the coffee nice and hot. Now the bad, and really the only bad I have found. That said, it is biggest factor. The coffee is weak almost every time. I use a burr grinder and have tried every type of coffee but it is still very weak imo. If you like strong coffee, this brewer is not for you. Honestly, it is weak enough that I am now shopping for a new coffee maker after 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful coffee maker for brewing a morning's worth of coffee for one person. I make coffee for myself and don't drink that many cups. I had another brand coffee maker that used to leave it tasting baked late in the morning. I've also tried single brew systems and just don't like all the paraphernalia. This model brews your coffee into an insulated carafe that keeps a few mugfuls toasty but not toasted. I also don't have to worry about the carafe breaking. Filters are widely available. I had to do some experimenting with water to ground coffee ratio, but found it at water to 4 cup mark, two scoops (2 Tbsp scoop) ground coffee in the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Dubliner

customer_reviews.title: Meh Carafe, Still Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before I bought this. Seems like the biggest complaint is the carafe. You can't get the last drops out no matter how hard you try (even shaking it upside down without the lid) which is definitely annoying. I haven't experienced any spilling from the spout that people talk about though. Overall I would buy again, even with the carafe, as everything else is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Pre-infusion's time is very short
customer_reviews.text: The time for pre-infusion is like 5-10 seconds. I think they had stated it should stop for about 30-45 seconds. Uses a lot more coffee than my moka pot to get the same amount of flavor and strength. Still working with amount and level of coarseness of beans.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow

customer_reviews.title: I wish I’d saved my money. I expected something special and missed the ‘returns’ window.
customer_reviews.text: I wish now I had returned it and purchased something less expensive. The coffee was no better or worse than my pour-over, or the Braun I’d had. I kept trying different beans and grinding my own to get the desired quality but, the coffee was still just ok. I recently had the best coffee ever at a friend’s and it was brewed in a Mr. Coffee, I was shocked! I did think the carafe kept the coffee warm for the relatively short time I needed it to. I liked the fact that there was no warmer, they are typically too hot and change the coffee’s flavor. Liked the feature that lets you dampen the grounds before the brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Single mug Bonavita beats single cup Keurig
customer_reviews.text: Bonavita missed a perfect opportunity to position this 5 cup unit as also being a excellent "single mug" brewer. Fill to the 3 cup line, brew and get one mug at a time. Fresh ground coffee is easier to pour into a #4 filter than a k-cup and it can hold many time what a k-cup can. The carafe comes out when brewing for others. Think Keuirg 2.0, just so much better.
customer_reviews.author: PeaS

customer_reviews.title: makes very good coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this coffee maker! My boyfriend did some research and there was a test where they tested more thank 20 coffee makers and this one was rated the highest, so we went for it. The coffee is very flavorful and at the perfect temperature for us. I only gave 4 stars because it is a little bit inconvenient that you have to unscrew the carafe lid to place the filter part on top then place it in the machine to brew. But other than that, it's so easy to use with just one switch to brew and turn off. I like that over too many technical features. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: VV

customer_reviews.title: Coffee had flavor, gf loves it
customer_reviews.text: Pro: am amazing coffee Makes just enough for me and another Easy to make coffee Easy to clean The decanter keeps hot Cons: Extra step in making coffee (inconvenience more than anything) The decenter doesn’t drain 100% more like 98% Overall: Worth the hassle and makes amazing coffee, I came from crappy coffee makers and didn’t know I could get this quality!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Have had since July 2015
customer_reviews.text: Have had since July 2015 works perfectly had only one issue dropped the basket and the handle broke off we contacted Bonavita and they replaced for free. This is what I don't understand about reviews of the pot leaking or other issues have these people tried contacting Bonavita before reviewing??? My two cents. Up date still going strong no additional issues 08.08.20
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: Awful. The maximum water temperature is180 degrees coming out of the drip head is not even close to what's needed. I measured it multiple times with two good thermometers. The carafe is so poorly designed that it 1) spills all over the place no matter how carefully you pour, and 2) traps liquid inside because of a plastic strip running below the inside of the rim. How this passed minimum quality control beats me. Packing it up to return.
customer_reviews.author: riversurf58

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Pot!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot! I normally use one of those one cup things but that limited the sorts of coffees I could use. I got this one because it's small and I rarely drink more than one or two cups on a given day. It's very easy to maintain, just rinse out the basket and clean the pot and most importantly, it actually makes a pretty good cup of coffee. It also take up almost no space on my already very limited counter top. I highly recommend this pot if you are like me and don't drink gallons of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Erich Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Fancier than me coffee
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy the one with temp control or timer. This is as bare bones as they got. Does it make a better pot of coffee than my $29 Mr. coffee? That's debateable. Also, I realize now I hate carafes. They just don't keep the coffee hot for more than an hour and a half. I even boil water ahead of time and dump into it to warm the carafe before I make the coffee. I do feel like I'm more bourgeoisie with this though. I can now look down on plebs with keurigs.
customer_reviews.author: Orangebang

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand the negative reviews. I went from pour over in my Hario to this (got lazy). Is it quite the same? No. But it’s the best coffee I’ve had from a coffee maker without spending a ton of money. If you read the instruction manual, the pre infusion mode is easy and so is everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Snow

customer_reviews.title: Economical choice for a great brew
customer_reviews.text: Not only does the coffee taste better when compared to our previous drip brewer, but this model uses 28% less coffee grounds for the same coffee output volume (24 fluid ounces). Given the odd way that the industry measures cups, that means that this 5 cup model produces a maximum of three 8oz cups. This is the perfect size for our household, but I'd recommend the 8 cup model if you need four or five 8oz servings from one brewing cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett McGowan

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: SO unhappy with this. It doesn't keep coffee hot after making it. My screw top pour leaks. I could have bought at $20 coffee maker that does more than this. Just the shower head for a "pour over" that doesn't even have a place to live after you're done with it? DO NOT BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: CeliacBeast

customer_reviews.title: Great  Coffee awkward design
customer_reviews.text: There's no where to leave the filter housing. It's an awkward coffee maker. Coffee is amazing but you need an extra plate or something on the counter to not drip coffee everywhere before you can pour coffee/put the lid on when the coffee is ready. Coffee is great tasting.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: My guests and I love it
customer_reviews.text: I get comments on the good looks and how well the carafe maintains temperature (I pre-warm with hot tap water). One relative got online and ordered one immediately and the other thought she'd order one when she got home. I'm pleased with the single, easy control and turning itself off when done brewing and I love the lack of constantly shining LEDs. In today's world we have too many gadgets with LEDs that never turn off. This brewer is simple to use and not annoying when not in use. It's on the small side which is OK for my daily use, and when I had company, I simply made two pots.
customer_reviews.author: Brien

customer_reviews.title: Love at last!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model to replace my Mochamaster. I just could not get the brew right on the big machine. Then read it does not make small pots well. Bought this unit along with the Baratza entry level grinder. Very happy with both! I grind beans every morning and the small pot is perfect. I am finally enjoying coffee again and drinking more than I am throwing out. Only complaint on the thermal carafe, hard to pour the last bit of coffee.... when I think it is empty, there is usually a good amount that won’t pour out.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca J. Sprunger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and quality coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've been making coffee manually for years using french presses, chemexes, moka pots, and I have an espresso machine, and yet I find myself using this coffee maker frequently as it is simple, and produces a high-quality cup of coffee. Perfect for one person, slightly less convenient if you're making coffee for two and each person drinks more than 1 standard mug per day. No timer feature on this one, but if you leave your grounds in the coffee maker overnight with a timer, then quality coffee isn't something you probably care about. It steams alot so don't brew underneath cabinetry etc. Been using pretty much daily for 6 months with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this little gem for a week. No issues whatsoever! Love that it has an auto shut off when it is done Brewing. I have the smaller machine and if I try to pour without the lid coffee gets all over the place. I take off the cone thing that you use for brewing screw on the lid and FANTISTICO!! not leaks.
customer_reviews.author: MCO

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this coffee maker for two years now. It works flawlessly. I like the stainless steel carafe and it doesn't leak for me. I put the top on to keep the coffee hot. Easy. The coffee taste great. What I was looking for originally was a coffee maker that made really hot coffee - the cheapo ones don't. I wanted this - precise 1100-watt heater maintains optimal brewing temperature of 195°-205°F (91°-96°C). And it does it. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Two
customer_reviews.text: I did my research, read dozens or reviews, and watched about a dozen videos. I wanted a compact, simple, beautiful coffee maker that served excellent coffee. This beautiful little brewer did not disappoint. I love it! I'm enjoying perfectly brewed Caffe Verona at this moment.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Miller

customer_reviews.title: Makes good coffee but the stainless carafe that came with mine is flawed...
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out the optimal grind size ( it took 2-3 times... ) this machine makes very good, ( hot ) coffee. However, the Stainless Carafe leaks unless I really crank the lid on super tight. So far, this is my only gripe with this moderately priced 5-cup machine.... we will see how well it holds up over time. The leaky Carafe, though somewhat irritating and occasionally messy, is not a deal-breaker - but it prevents me from giving this coffee maker more than 3 1/2 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: Caraff needs work (sp)
customer_reviews.text: Generally a very good machine. The only problem is you cannot get all the coffee out of the bucket! Which also means it is a bit hard to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Retired in Leeds

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic well made little coffee maker! No bells and whistles just a simple easy to use coffee brewer that gets the job done. The bloom setting is a great feature. I measured the water temp and it is right around 200F where it needs to be. I also purchased a Breville smart burr grinder and I am amazed at the coffee I am getting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What is a cup?
customer_reviews.text: I hate to give this 1 STAR, because I never used it. But it says 5 cups, in reading additional comments I discovered this was 5 cups that were only 5 ounces each! I usually get a Starbucks Venti (20 oz) so this was just 1 large cup and no refills to take to work with me. I sadly returned it for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Lancer 27

customer_reviews.title: Love it for several reasons: Temperature, Taste and Carafe size
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker! The carafe fits perfectly down into the armrest of my Subaru. The 5 cup option is just enough to enjoy the pot throughout the morning once I get to my office - the coffee stays hot for several hours! No need to transfer it from the carafe to a thermos or another coffee mug, so it doesn't lose its temperature. I highly recommend this coffee maker, it is simple without all of the buttons that I never had used on prior makers. It showers the coffee grounds for a nice taste and it brews HOT, not luke warm. It is a low profile unit that fits nicely underneath my cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Beth M

customer_reviews.title: Love this little coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I needed a little coffee maker for just me each morning. This little coffee maker is perfect. it works best if you grind your own beans on a coarse setting. They consider a cup of coffee 8 ounces. I like a full mug of coffee so I usually make a full pot (5 cups) or 4 cups. I set it up the night before and in the morning all I do is flip the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Smith

customer_reviews.title: It brews coffee pretty well, but the carafe leaks
customer_reviews.text: I'm satisfied with how it brews coffee, but the carafe often leaks when pouring. I haven't figure out what is wrong with the lid seal yet. Sometimes it leaks with each cup poured, other times it leaks with just the first cup. It's bizarre, and I now pour my coffee at my kitchen sink. The Bonavita 8-cup thermal carafe never leaked once. The lids on both the 5-cup and the 8-cup are a nuisance to clean, but I found the 5-cup is somewhat easier.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Bonavita
customer_reviews.text: So glad I read some really good reviews about the coffee maker. I have tried countless coffee makers to get a really good cup of coffee. WOW, Bonavita is the the best. I grind my own beans the coffee maker makes absolutely the best coffee! I do highly recommend it. The key is to read the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Cobban

customer_reviews.title: Simple and makes a great cup
customer_reviews.text: In my search for a coffee maker, I finally concluded that above all, a great cup was what I was looking for. Although this model doesn't have a program feature, it is the simplicity and the fact that it makes a GREAT CUP OF COFFEE that makes me love this machine. Its more expensive that my Mr. Coffee machine, but I really can taste the flavor now. This is my favorite by far. Happy coffee drinker here! Good luck in your search. I've found mine.
customer_reviews.author: GizzleDawg

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: Makes a great tasting cup of coffee. When I bought it, I was concerned about the carafe keeping the coffee warm. I’m not concerned anymore, three hours later it’s still warm. It brews the coffee at a higher temp than the k machine I had before. It makes a fantastic cup of coffee and can fill my Yeti coffee mug twice.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the mess?
customer_reviews.text: I do like this coffee maker for the size and flavor. We started with a Bodum electric pour over which mostly I loved (have a review there as well) but it broke down after a few years. However, I have not had this very long - a few months - and it leaks very bad. The rubber seal on the lid looks worn and it’s very hard to clean the pot. I haven’t found many electric pour overs and once you get used to the flavor it’s hard to go back to drip. I do love that it’s the perfect size to fit under my kitchen shelves tho.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Kiedrowski

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee but a bit fiddly
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes some of the best coffee I have ever had! The only drawback is it's a bit fiddly - you have to use the lid on the garage to pour water into the water reservoir or it drips/spills. Then you have to remove the lid to pour out the water since you can't pour all the water out with the lid on. You also have to do this for the last bits of coffee. It's a small thing, but it is a bit annoying and the only reason this didn't get five stars
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A

customer_reviews.title: Thermos Coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is perfect but this is a good little unit. It looks good, makes hot coffee and holds the heat pretty well. I like strong coffee and the fact that it uses a #4 rather than #2 filter is extremely nice. No more grounds in my coffee from when the little filters overflowed. It’s easy to keep clean. But—, i don’t care for coffee that has been in a thermos for even 30 minutes. It might still be hot but loses it’s flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Terry B.

customer_reviews.title: BEST coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap. This is the BEST coffee maker I've ever had the pleasure of owning. I saw this in an America's Test Kitchen video and I'm so glad I decided to buy it. If you buy high end coffee, this coffee maker will make it perfectly so you can enjoy all the wonderful flavors they advertise.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gallik

customer_reviews.title: Great product just the right size
customer_reviews.text: It makes great coffee and just the right amount for morning. I was looking for a coffee maker that didn’t have the coffee pot sitting on a hot plate because then it taste burnt. I get out before my wife have my coffee and then when my wife gets up about an hour later the coffee is hot and not tasting burnt in the carafe. It makes 5 cups which normally is just the right amount if I need more it makes more in five minutes. I would highly recommend this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: M. Iodice

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, kludgy design because of the lid.
customer_reviews.text: Brews a decent cup of coffee. A bit kludgy with the lid, but it pours fine if the lid is put on properly. However, there is no place to keep it (except putting it away) while the pot is brewing. When the lid is on, the filter has to be stowed somewhere which again can create a mess with the drips. It would be nice if it would pour well without the lid, especially if you don't plan on drinking the coffee immediately. Then the lid can be used only when needed to keep the carafe warm.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker except...
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine coffee maker for someone like me who doesn't drink a lot of coffee at one go. The problem is the carafe. It's very nice in that it is double-wall insulated, but the way the plastic handle is manufactured to the stainless steel body prevents one from ever being able to pour all the coffee out...there is a pronounced lip around the inside where the plastic meets the steel that inhibits the flow of the liquid. If you try to pour the coffee from the carafe without the lid on it just goes everywhere, but with the lid on you always have coffee left in the carafe...it's a no win.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L.

customer_reviews.title: happy senior citizen
customer_reviews.text: love this item....coffee stays hot brews nicely and can deliver a four cups perfectly + easy clean up.....just needed a simple good thermal brew for a daily cup of Java !
customer_reviews.author: DRL

customer_reviews.title: Carafe leaks when just sitting upright.
customer_reviews.text: Brewed the first pot of coffee. Made nice coffee however, I made the mistake of setting the carafe on the counter instead of the sink. When I returned for a second cup the counter was flooded. Upon inspection the coffee was leaking out at the joint between the stainless steel and the plastic. The seal between the plastic and stainless steel portion must be bad or a poor design. Whatever, Amazon was wonderful in refunding me the purchase price upon return.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ignorant Design
customer_reviews.text: What a stupid stupid design, the basket can’t slide in separately? You have to carefully slide it in with the pot itself, when you stay and pour it goes all over the place unless you put the lid on, but why would I if I am filling up my cup. Did any one even run this by a 2 year old . My god what a joke
customer_reviews.author: Sean252

customer_reviews.title: HOT water = key to great coffee
customer_reviews.text: How to choose among all these small coffee makers? The Bonavita is so good because it heats the water much hotter than others, key to getting all the flavor. And the size is perfect for small households.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Wastefully Makes Good Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've used this coffee maker for nearly two years now, and my frustration with the design of the pot has surpassed my pleasure with the quality of the brewing. As other reviews mention (reviews that I chose to ignore), the thermal-pot traps some of the coffee so it cannot be poured -- it must be shaken out. Even with the lid removed and the pot inverted, it must be shaken to get the last of the coffee out. This is best done over the sink, so you may watch your quality joe go down the drain. What a shame, because the machine really does make a delicious brew.
customer_reviews.author: J.W. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great except for the carafe spout
customer_reviews.text: My husband is the head roaster of a big coffee shop, we know our coffee. We own every manual method. Doing a pour- over with a kid on your hip at 6am isn't my favorite thing though, so I had to get something more automatic for work days. The coffee quality is great, but as many have said you can't pour the damn carafe without the lid on it. This is especially annoying because once the lid is on the spout pours verrry slowly, annoying when you are using it to fill the machine with 25oz of water.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, poor quality unit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in November and started having issues with it right away. Didn’t mind at first because it brews well and easy to use—however it only got worse. The main unit will spill water over the counter even below the max fill line. The lid needed to be screwed past the handle to not leak out and eventually caused it to break (photo above). It’s not the biggest deal but the design basically leaves liquid in the pot when washing. Need to air dry entirely or shove a washcloth in to soak everything up. Just strange design for a somewhat nicer coffee pot.
customer_reviews.author: Jamison

customer_reviews.title: Brews delicious coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Makes a delicious cup of coffee. It is a hassle to clean but the results is a smooth and flavorful coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great coffeemaker: easy, tasty coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffeemaker. The process is simple but effective. It's like a pour-over without the standing around and waiting. It's easy to get started and cleanup is super simple. I really like the pre-infusion mode -- try it! The 5-cup size is perfect for me -- I make 1/2 a pot which fills my thermos each morning. I use Peet's fresh ground coffee and it tastes great. No plastic taste like some other new coffee makers on the market (that I tried and tossed before finding that Bonavita are BPA-free).
customer_reviews.author: S. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Nice design but I got a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Bought a unit discounted due to cosmetic issues so I assumed it not look perfect but would work well. Nope. This thing leaks like a sieve. I think that may be on Amazon for reselling it more than the manufacturers. I got a lemon. Too bad because the design is perfect for what I needed it for. I may roll the dice and buy a new one and see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: Julie T

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, superfast, flawed carafe design
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffemaker. I give it 4 stars because as others have pointed out, the carafe is a dribbling mess unless you use the lid. Must pour coffee over sink, use a different pitcher to fill reservoir. Seems like a simple design fix...
customer_reviews.author: susulah X

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic small coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when my new coffee maker arrive at my door the day after I ordered it. I have been using another coffee maker for several years, but it finally stopped working. The Bonavita 5 cup makes an excellent cup of coffee. I did not realize how good my coffe could taste. I expect to get many years of great coffee from this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Henry J. Schaumburger

customer_reviews.title: More consistent than manual cone pour overs
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand the negative reviews. This is the best automatic coffee maker I’ve ever owned. If your coffee is freshly burr ground, recently roasted, and not garbage quality (Trader Joe’s or Dunkin‘ Donuts) you will have better coffee than most cafes.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My cheap old coffee maker suddenly died and I had wanted the 8-cup Bonavita but the price was a bit hard to justify. I'm the only coffee drinker in my house and I use my French press on the weekend so I didn't want to spend a lot. Then I found this 5-cup version for half the price. I can't say it's as good as a press, but it's the best I've had from a machine. I was nervous after I ordered then read the review on cnet where they bashed it. I completely disagree with that review! If this is the size maker you need, it's worth the price. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Carlton

customer_reviews.title: B+
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, I have bought 2 of these and really like them! One complaint is that the top of the coffee pot lid leaks big time on both products. Even if you tighten it, it will still leak, pretty annoying and definitely a design defect since it has happened on multiple models.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Fenger

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: My brother in law has the technivorm and I wanted to get something nearly as good. This does the job. Using a digital thermometer the water does stay in the golden zone for coffee, so it does live true to that promise. My only complaint is that the top of the pot always has a ring of coffee that needs to be wiped before the lid it screwed on
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Messy messy messy!
customer_reviews.text: I was told by a coffee guru that this was the only at home coffee maker on the market that gets the water hot enough to make a real cup of coffee. While that it true, it leaks everywhere! Messy messy messy. The spout on the carafe isn’t deep enough so when you fill it with water and pour it in the machine, you leak everywhere. Pouring it into a coffee cup is worse. Comes out the sides and gets all over the place. I spend more time cleaning up after using it then actually drinking coffee
customer_reviews.author: Sara Borusiewich

customer_reviews.title: Defective when received
customer_reviews.text: 1st . time I tried just brewing 5 cups of water. Steamed a lot but less than a cup was sent to the carafe. Stopped after 6 minutes. Made sure the top was secure and in place and tried again. Still, boiling water but sending very little to carafe. There's no seal on the shower head. Looks like bottom of shower head is missing. Sending the unit back today.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the taste of the coffee from this little machine. I experimented with the grind of the coffee and amount to use for 2 cups of coffee and have found just the right combination that gives me a perfect cup of coffee. I pre-warm the carafe with hot water and it holds my second cup hot enough for me to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Ships in original box
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift. It came to our house shopping in the original box. Now it’s soaking wet, dented and covered in shipping labels.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrel's mom

customer_reviews.title: It's A Bit Different
customer_reviews.text: It's fast, brews very good coffee, and at a high enough temperature. The carafe does not pour well without out the lid on--the lid's okay for multiple cups, helps keep the coffee hot in the carafe, of course. If I'm making a single cup, though, well, the lid shouldn't be necessary, but the carafe dribbles a lot when pouring without it. The lid's top must be removed to clean the assembly well, the top is a fiddly bit. It's not easy to pour all the coffee out from the carafe, either.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a single cup serving coffee machine for years. Hated cleaning and flavor was never that great. Bought this and I got rid of my single cup machine. The flavor is so much better. Easy making and cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Coffee maker makes coffee
customer_reviews.text: Hits the right temperature without burning or cooling. The insulated carafe keeps coffee hot for a surprisingly long time for a simple and cheap coffee maker. It's rated highly by coffee snobs. Use a #4 paper filter.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you love well-made coffee
customer_reviews.text: Makes excellent coffee! Love the smaller size, as there is just one coffee drinker in the house. FOLLOW the INSTRUCTIONS that come with the coffee maker. You must use a coarse grind. And use the recommended amount of coffee beans. As for those who gripe about not being able to interrupt the brew cycle to grab a cup? Well, if you can't wait ~90 seconds for your coffee, maybe this isn't the brewer for you. I've been very pleased with this coffee maker, and have even purchased as housewarming gifts for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt T

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker ever
customer_reviews.text: One of the best pour over style coffe makers out there. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Poloplayersgirl

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding coffeemaker!
customer_reviews.text: This coffeemaker is outstanding! We grind the same beans we were using and the flavor is enhanced and there is no bitterness. It’s fast and automatically turns off when brewed directly into the stainless thermal carafe which keeps the coffee hot for hours.
customer_reviews.author: bv

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t turn on the machine
customer_reviews.text: When I turned it on, the light blinked for a second and then turned off. Didn’t work. I had to use an adapter because I’m in Hong Kong - this product burnt couple of my adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Kakasensei

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean, and makes GREAT coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This is everything a small coffeemaker should be. It looks good, is easy to use, easy to clean, holds the brewing temperature right in the target zone, and has a selectable pre-infusion cycle. Best of all, it makes great coffee. It can also be used with Bonavita's double-wall glass carafe, which makes for a really nice appearance on the kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: NorCalFunJunky

customer_reviews.title: A simple but excellent coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Bonavita coffee maker (the other one is at my vacation home). While it is a machine without frills, it makes excellent coffee; most importantly, it uses hot enough water to infuse the grounds to produce a product that is the right temperature once it is in the cup. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Perikles

customer_reviews.title: It brews a great cup of coffee but it's the issues others have ...
customer_reviews.text: It brews a great cup of coffee but it's the issues others have mentioned that knock it down a couple of stars. It's annoying that you have to put the lid on to pour the coffee. It's especially annoying since you're probably only pouring 1-2 mugs of coffee. There's a lip on the inside rim that prevents you from completely emptying the carafe--whether that's coffee or while washing it.
customer_reviews.author: Sang

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best coffee maker I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best coffee maker I have ever owned. After decades of brewing a fair cup of coffee, I have now started to brew the best coffee. So good is the brewing capabilities of the Bonavita, that I now buy whole bean coffee of various blends because now I can taste the subtitles of the bean. Each cup I brew just gets better and better. What’s in your cup?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Former K cup user
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to reduce the amount of money I was spending on K cups, between myself, wife and daughter, we went through 6 per day. Boy I had no idea what I was missing out on, this little wonder makes a delicious five cup pot of coffee, the flavor is rich multi layered, while not being bitter. The carafe keeps the coffee warm for only a few hours, for the cost I think that's the only negative. Simple and easy to use , and a cinch to clean, I highly recommend this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Meister

customer_reviews.title: best little coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I own the Bonavita 1900 and bought the 1500 for a trip. Perfect little coffee maker. The carafe works fine.
customer_reviews.author: King Cormack

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee, but only 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: The lid on the carafe likes to leak when I pour coffee out of it. Not a lot, but just enough to drive me a little crazy. The company actually sent me a second carafe and it does it too! The coffee is great and just enough for one person.
customer_reviews.author: Lance K. Mertz

product_meta.title: Bonavita 5-Cup One-Touch Coffee Maker Featuring Thermal Carafe, BV1500TS
product_meta.description: Engineered to similar brewing specifications as our popular 8-cup series brewers, the BV1500TS is the perfect coffee maker for individuals who prefer to brew their coffee in smaller 4-5 cup batches. This appliance has a polarized plug
feature_bullets: Powerful and precise 1100-watt heater maintains optimal brewing temperature of 198°-205°F (92°-96°C)
Optional pre-infusion mode saturates freshly roasted ground coffee to allow degassing before brewing
Specially designed showerhead for ideal extraction in small batch sizes
Durable stainless steel lined thermal carafe.Performance coffee brewer makes an 5-cup carafe in approximately 6 minutes
Carafe lid, filter basket, and showerhead are dishwasher safe

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,289 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
